tags.name: connectors
tags.description: Connector APIs enable you to create and manage connectors.

post.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

schema.title: Create connector request body properties
schema.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

get.description: You must have `read` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

delete.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges. WARNING: When you delete a connector, it cannot be recovered.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

put.summary: Updates the attributes for a connector.
put.description: You must have `all` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges.

schema.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

items.description: The properties vary for each connector type.

config.description: The configuration for the connector. Configuration properties vary depending on the connector type.

referenced_by_count.description: Indicates the number of saved objects that reference the connector. If `is_preconfigured` is true, this value is not calculated.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of all connector types.
get.description: You do not need any Kibana feature privileges to run this API.

parameters.name: feature_id
parameters.description: A filter to limit the retrieved connector types to those that support a specific feature (such as alerting or cases).

schema.title: Get connector types response body properties
schema.description: The properties vary for each connector type.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in Kibana.

enabled_in_config.description: Indicates whether the connector type is enabled in the Kibana `.yml` file.

enabled_in_license.description: Indicates whether the connector is enabled in the license.

minimum_license_required.description: The license that is required to use the connector type.

name.description: The name of the connector type.

supported_feature_ids.description: The Kibana features that are supported by the connector type.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

post.description: You can use this API to test an action that involves interaction with Kibana services or integrations with third-party systems. You must have `read` privileges for the **Actions and Connectors** feature in the **Management** section of the Kibana feature privileges. If you use an index connector, you must also have `all`, `create`, `index`, or `write` indices privileges.

schema.title: Run connector request body properties
schema.description: The properties vary depending on the connector type.

oneOf.description: Information returned from the action.
An array of information returned from the action.

401.description: Authorization information is missing or invalid.

space_id.name: spaceId
space_id.description: An identifier for the space. If `/s/` and the identifier are omitted from the path, the default space is used.

config_properties_cases_webhook.title: Connector request properties for Webhook - Case Management connector
config_properties_cases_webhook.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.cases-webhook`.

createCommentJson.description: A JSON payload sent to the create comment URL to create a case comment. You can use variables to add Kibana Cases data to the payload. The required variable is `case.comment`. Due to Mustache template variables (the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated once the Mustache variables have been placed when the REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid, disregarding the Mustache variables, so the later validation will pass.

createCommentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to create a case comment in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

createCommentUrl.description: The REST API URL to create a case comment by ID in the third-party system. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts setting`, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

createIncidentJson.description: A JSON payload sent to the create case URL to create a case. You can use variables to add case data to the payload. Required variables are `case.title` and `case.description`. Due to Mustache template variables (which is the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid to avoid future validation errors; disregard Mustache variables during your review.

createIncidentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to create a case in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

createIncidentResponseKey.description: The JSON key in the create case response that contains the external case ID.

createIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to create a case in the third-party system. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

getIncidentResponseExternalTitleKey.description: The JSON key in get case response that contains the external case title.

getIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to get the case by ID from the third-party system. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. Due to Mustache template variables (the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid, disregarding the Mustache variables, so the later validation will pass.

hasAuth.description: If true, a username and password for login type authentication must be provided.

headers.description: A set of key-value pairs sent as headers with the request URLs for the create case, update case, get case, and create comment methods.

updateIncidentJson.description: The JSON payload sent to the update case URL to update the case. You can use variables to add Kibana Cases data to the payload. Required variables are `case.title` and `case.description`. Due to Mustache template variables (which is the text enclosed in triple braces, for example, `{{{case.title}}}`), the JSON is not validated when you create the connector. The JSON is validated after the Mustache variables have been placed when REST method runs. Manually ensure that the JSON is valid to avoid future validation errors; disregard Mustache variables during your review.

updateIncidentMethod.description: The REST API HTTP request method to update the case in the third-party system. Valid values are `patch`, `post`, and `put`.

updateIncidentUrl.description: The REST API URL to update the case by ID in the third-party system. You can use a variable to add the external system ID to the URL. If you are using the `xpack.actions.allowedHosts` setting, add the hostname to the allowed hosts.

viewIncidentUrl.description: The URL to view the case in the external system. You can use variables to add the external system ID or external system title to the URL.

secrets_properties_cases_webhook.title: Connector secrets properties for Webhook - Case Management connector

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

user.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. If `hasAuth` is set to `true`, this property is required.

config_properties_servicenow.title: Connector request properties for a ServiceNow ITSM connector
config_properties_servicenow.description: Defines properties for connectors when type is `.servicenow`.

clientId.description: The client ID assigned to your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

isOAuth.description: The type of authentication to use. The default value is false, which means basic authentication is used instead of open authorization (OAuth).

jwtKeyId.description: The key identifier assigned to the JWT verifier map of your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

userIdentifierValue.description: The identifier to use for OAuth authentication. This identifier should be the user field you selected when you created an OAuth JWT API endpoint for external clients in your ServiceNow instance. For example, if the selected user field is `Email`, the user identifier should be the user's email address. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

usesTableApi.description: Determines whether the connector uses the Table API or the Import Set API. This property is supported only for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.  NOTE: If this property is set to `false`, the Elastic application should be installed in ServiceNow.

secrets_properties_servicenow.title: Connector secrets properties for ServiceNow ITOM, ServiceNow ITSM, and ServiceNow SecOps connectors
secrets_properties_servicenow.description: Defines secrets for connectors when type is `.servicenow`, `.servicenow-sir`, or `.servicenow-itom`.

clientSecret.description: The client secret assigned to your OAuth application. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

password.description: The password for HTTP basic authentication. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `false`.

privateKey.description: The RSA private key that you created for use in ServiceNow. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true`.

privateKeyPassword.description: The password for the RSA private key. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `true` and you set a password on your private key.

username.description: The username for HTTP basic authentication. This property is required when `isOAuth` is `false`.

connector_types.title: Connector types
connector_types.description: The type of connector. For example, `.email`, `.index`, `.jira`, `.opsgenie`, or `.server-log`.

features.description: The feature that uses the connector. Valid values are `alerting`, `cases`, `uptime`, and `siem`.

run_connector_request_index.title: Run index connector parameters
run_connector_request_index.description: Test an action that indexes a document into Elasticsearch.

documents.description: The documents to index in JSON format.

run_connector_request_jira.title: Run Jira connector parameters
run_connector_request_jira.description: Test an action related to Jira issues.

oneOf.description: Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `fieldsByIssueType`.
Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `getFields`.
Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `getIncident`.
Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `issue`.
Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `issues`.

title.description: The title of the Jira issue.

oneOf.description: Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `issueTypes`.
Jira connector properties when `subAction` is `pushToService`.

comments.description: Additional information that is sent to Jira.

comment.description: A comment related to the incident. For example, describe how to troubleshoot the issue.

commentId.description: A unique identifier for the comment.

incident.description: Information necessary to create or update a Jira incident.

externalId.description: The Jira issue identifier. If present, the incident is updated. Otherwise, a new incident is created.

labels.description: The labels for the incident. For example, `["LABEL1"]`. NOTE: Labels cannot contain spaces.

issueType.description: The type of incident. For example, `10006`. To obtain the list of valid values, set `subAction` to `issueTypes`.

parent.description: The ID or key of the parent issue. Applies only to `Sub-task` types of issues.

priority.description: The incident priority level. For example, `Lowest`.

title.description: A title for the incident, used for searching the contents of the knowledge base.

oneOf.description: Opsgenie connector properties when `subAction` is `closeAlert`.

alias.description: The unique identifier used for alert deduplication in Opsgenie. The alias must match the value used when creating the alert.

source.description: The display name for the source of the alert.

user.description: The display name for the owner.

oneOf.description: Opsgenie connector properties when `subAction` is `createAlert`.

actions.description: The custom actions available to the alert.

alias.description: The unique identifier used for alert deduplication in Opsgenie.

description.description: A description that provides detailed information about the alert.

details.description: The custom properties of the alert.

entity.description: The domain of the alert. For example, the application or server name.

priority.description: The priority level for the alert.

responders.description: The entities to receive notifications about the alert. If `type` is `user`, either `id` or `username` is required. If `type` is `team`, either `id` or `name` is required.

name.description: The name of the entity.

type.description: The type of responders, in this case `escalation`.

username.description: A valid email address for the user.

source.description: The display name for the source of the alert.

user.description: The display name for the owner.

visibleTo.description: The teams and users that the alert will be visible to without sending a notification. Only one of `id`, `name`, or `username` is required.

name.description: The name of the entity.

username.description: The user name. This property is required only when the `type` is `user`.

run_connector_request_serverlog.title: Run server log connector parameters
run_connector_request_serverlog.description: Test an action that writes an entry to the Kibana server log.

level.description: The log level of the message.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow ITSM connector properties when `subAction` is `getChoices`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow ITSM connector properties when `subAction` is `getFields`.
ServiceNow ITSM connector properties when `subAction` is `getIncident`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow ITSM connector properties when `subAction` is `pushToService`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

comments.description: Additional information that is sent to ServiceNow ITSM.

comment.description: A comment related to the incident. For example, describe how to troubleshoot the issue.

commentId.description: A unique identifier for the comment.

incident.description: Information necessary to create or update a ServiceNow ITSM incident.

correlation_display.description: A descriptive label of the alert for correlation purposes in ServiceNow.

correlation_id.description: The correlation identifier for the security incident. Connectors using the same correlation ID are associated with the same ServiceNow incident. This value determines whether a new ServiceNow incident is created or an existing one is updated. Modifying this value is optional; if not modified, the rule ID and alert ID are combined as `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` to form the correlation ID value in ServiceNow. The maximum character length for this value is 100 characters. NOTE: Using the default configuration of `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` ensures that ServiceNow creates a separate incident record for every generated alert that uses a unique alert ID. If the rule generates multiple alerts that use the same alert IDs, ServiceNow creates and continually updates a single incident record for the alert.

externalId.description: The ServiceNow ITSM issue identifier. If present, the incident is updated. Otherwise, a new incident is created.

short_description.description: A short description for the incident, used for searching the contents of the knowledge base.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow ITOM connector properties when `subAction` is `addEvent`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

event_class.description: A specific instance of the source.

message_key.description: All actions sharing this key are associated with the same ServiceNow alert. The default value is `<rule ID>:<alert instance ID>`.

node.description: The host that the event was triggered for.

source.description: The name of the event source type.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow ITOM connector properties when `subAction` is `getChoices`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow SecOps connector properties when `subAction` is `getChoices`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow SecOps connector properties when `subAction` is `getFields`.
ServiceNow SecOps connector properties when `subAction` is `getIncident`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

oneOf.description: ServiceNow SecOps connector properties when `subAction` is `pushToService`.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

comments.description: Additional information that is sent to ServiceNow SecOps.

comment.description: A comment related to the incident. For example, describe how to troubleshoot the issue.

commentId.description: A unique identifier for the comment.

incident.description: Information necessary to create or update a ServiceNow SecOps incident.

correlation_display.description: A descriptive label of the alert for correlation purposes in ServiceNow.

correlation_id.description: The correlation identifier for the security incident. Connectors using the same correlation ID are associated with the same ServiceNow incident. This value determines whether a new ServiceNow incident is created or an existing one is updated. Modifying this value is optional; if not modified, the rule ID and alert ID are combined as `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` to form the correlation ID value in ServiceNow. The maximum character length for this value is 100 characters. NOTE: Using the default configuration of `{{ruleID}}:{{alert ID}}` ensures that ServiceNow creates a separate incident record for every generated alert that uses a unique alert ID. If the rule generates multiple alerts that use the same alert IDs, ServiceNow creates and continually updates a single incident record for the alert.

dest_ip.description: A list of destination IP addresses related to the security incident. The IPs are added as observables to the security incident.

externalId.description: The ServiceNow SecOps issue identifier. If present, the incident is updated. Otherwise, a new incident is created.

malware_hash.description: A list of malware hashes related to the security incident. The hashes are added as observables to the security incident.

malware_url.description: A list of malware URLs related to the security incident. The URLs are added as observables to the security incident.

short_description.description: A short description for the incident, used for searching the contents of the knowledge base.

source_ip.description: A list of source IP addresses related to the security incident. The IPs are added as observables to the security incident.

subActionParams.description: The set of configuration properties for the action.

comments.description: Additional information that is setnt to Swimlane

comment.description: A comment related to the incident. For example, describe how to troubleshoot the issue.

commentId.description: A unique identifier for the comment.

incident.description: Information necessary to create or update a Swimlane incident.

caseId.description: The case identifier for the incident.

caseName.description: The case name for the incident.
